title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the answer

Average acceleration of rocket A is

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the explanation

1 point is earned if uses v(20), v(40), v(60)

1 point is earned for the value

Since the velocity is positive, ∫ 10 70 v( t ) dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaWaa8qmaeaaca WG2bWaaeWaaeaacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaleaacaaIXaGaaGim aaqaaiaaiEdacaaIWaaaniabgUIiYdGccaWGKbGaamiDaaaa@4078@ represents the distance, in feet, traveled by rocket A from t = 10 seconds to t = 70 seconds.

A midpoint Riemann sum is

20[v(20) + v(40) + v(60)]

= 20[22 + 35 + 44] = 2020 ft

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for 6 t + 1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGOnamaaka aabaGaamiDaiabgUcaRiaaigdaaSqabaaaaa@3967@

1 point is earned for constant of integration

1 point is earned for uses initial condition

1 point is earned for v B ( 80 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3AC1@ , compares to v(80), and draws a conclusion

Let v B ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A3E@ be the velocity of rocket B at time t.

v B ( t ) = ∫ 3 t + 1 d t = 6 t + 1 + C 2 = v B ( 0 ) = 6 + C v B ( t ) = 6 t + 1 − 4 v B ( 80 ) = 50 > 49 = v B ( 80 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6D1D@

Rocket B is traveling faster at time t = 80 seconds.
